author: cmpilato
msg: * tools/cgi/tweak-log.cgi
(doFetchLog): html-escape the current log that inits the textarea.

author: cmpilato
msg: More URI en-coding fixes.
* subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c
(repos_to_repos_copy, wc_to_repos_copy): URI-decode URL portions
used as paths.
* subversion/libsvn_client/delete.c
(svn_client_delete): URI-decode URL portions used as paths.
* subversion/libsvn_client/switch.c
(svn_client_switch): Minor code formatting.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(recursively_tweak_entries): URI-encode path items used as URLs.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/props.c
(svn_ra_dav__do_check_path, svn_ra_dav__get_baseline_info):
URI-encode path items used as URLs.
* subversion/libsvn_client/add.c
(svn_client_mkdir): URI-decode URL portions used as paths.

author: rooneg
msg: update the freebsd port to version 0.14.0
this is a work in progress.  it has all the documentation installing hacked
out until i can do it correctly, and i want to try to get this working with
the version of apache2 in the freebsd ports tree, but that will require more
makefile gymnastics than i'm currently in the mood for.
* packages/freebsd/subversion/distinfo
update checksums
* packages/freebsd/subversion/pkg-message
remove this warning, since now we really do want people to use this thing.
* packages/freebsd/subversion/pkg-plist
add svn_utf.h and temporarily remove the info files.
* packages/freebsd/subversion/Makefile
remove the warning printout, update for new location of tarball, depend on
a more recent version of expat since it's been updated in the freebsd ports
tree, remove the reference to the makefile since i'd rather not install any
docs than install something that is as out of date as that currently is,
and hack around the fact that the makefile tries to install info documents
that hasn't been built.

author: rooneg
msg: * tags/0.6
last but certainly not least, a tag for 0.6, the first release to have
an actual version number assigned to it.

author: rooneg
msg: * tags/0.7
it's only fitting that we have a tag for 0.7, since that's when we first
had a working 'svn cp' command to let us create tags ;-)
